sentence.text: She walked up the path and rang the bell , and while she stood waiting she could hear the television blaring inside .
With sirens blaring and amber lights flashing , the squad cars slewed to a halt at the rear of a war-torn Cadillac .
Across the water , the loud hailers were blaring and squealing as they had in the winter , when Tzani-bey had caught and herded the Order .
In early April , in fine spring weather , the miners went back to work , ` their heads held high " , with brass bands blaring and ancient banners on display .
FIREMEN and police turned up at a house in Bracknell , Herts , with sirens blaring after Nibbles the hamster became trapped under the bath .
He was n't sure whether the klaxon blared first or the perimeter floodlights snapped on , saturating the clearing with harsh blinding light .
Scramble klaxons must be blaring on nearby Luftwaffe fields : Barton had no doubt of that .
He was also asleep when a gramophone blared from the open window of a flat in the block across the way .
The mist still limited visibility to less than a hundred yards and the fog-horn continued to blare at regular intervals .
THE TV was blaring in the corner , displaying EastEnders in black and white .
Somewhere behind her a horn blared .
More trucks were arriving , many of them with sirens blaring .
Suddenly behind him , out on the pool , another horn blared .
They hurtled past , just across the street , with their whistles blaring .
Through open windows or balcony doors came the mingled sounds of pots clattering and televisions blaring , an indication that most families were having their evening meal .
The television blared , and then I noticed the electricity advertisements : an electric stove , an electric heater , an electric boiler .
